text: <extra_id_0> Alpha 4 beta 1 (CD49d/CD29) integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> costimulation of human T cells enhances transcription factor and cytokine induction in the absence of altered sensitivity to anti-CD3 stimulation .

The <extra_id_0> integrin alpha 4 beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can provide a costimulus to induce <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion and <extra_id_0> IL-2R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression leading to enhanced proliferation of purified , peripheral blood T cells .

text: Similar to expression of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we demonstrated that recombinant <extra_id_0> vascular-cell adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , when co-immobilized with anti-CD3 mAb , significantly enhanced the induction of transcription factors NF-AT , AP-1 , and NF-kappa B as determined by electromobility shift assays .
<extra_id_0> alpha 4 beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation alone had no effect on transcription factor binding .

The requirements for induction of transcription factors reflected the requirements for the secretion of multiple cytokines , including <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> granulocyte macrophage-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In contrast to freshly isolated T cells , in vitro-cultured T cells did not require costimulation for cytokine secretion in response to anti-CD3 alone .

Comparison of the dose response to anti-CD3 stimulation demonstrated that half - maximal induction of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was achieved using the same dose of anti-CD3 for both freshly isolated and cultured T cells .

Furthermore , the dose of OKT3 required to achieve half - maximal activation was the same using PMA or different concentrations of <extra_id_0> alpha 4 beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligands .
Therefore , costimulation by <extra_id_0> alpha 4 beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligands was not due to stabilization of the interaction of the cells with its substrate .

We conclude , rather , that <extra_id_0> alpha 4 beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in freshly isolated T cells delivers a distinct signal that synergizes early with signals initiated by TCR / CD3 ligation to induce DNA binding of multiple transcription factors required for cytokine gene induction .
